medium: Pen and brown ink on tan laid paper
creditline: Gift of Emily Townsend Vermeule, honorary degree holder of the Class of 1989, and Cornelius Clarkson Vermeule III, in memory of Alphaeus Hyatt Mayor, Class of 1922, George Rodney Meneely, Class of 1933, and Cornelius Clarkson Vermeule Jr., Class of 1917
markings: Watermark: Duck within circle, with P above (similar to Briquet 12210, Syracuse 1591)

makers.displaymaker: attributed to Francesco Villamena, Assisi 1564–1624 Rome

bibliography.boilertext: "Acquisitions of the Art Museum 1997," in "A Window into Collecting American Folk Art: The Edward Duff Balken Collection at Princeton," special issue, Record of the Art Museum, Princeton University 57, no. 1/2 (1998): p. 164-208.
bibliography.citation: "Acquisitions of the Art Museum 1997," in "A Window into Collecting American Folk Art: The Edward Duff Balken Collection at Princeton," special issue, Record of the Art Museum, Princeton University 57, no. 1/2 (1998): p. 164-208., p. 174

bibliography.boilertext: Laura Giles, Lia Markey, Claire Van Cleave, et. al., Italian Master Drawings from the Princeton University Art Museum, (Princeton, NJ: Princeton University Art Museum, 2014).
bibliography.citation: Laura Giles, Lia Markey, Claire Van Cleave, et. al., Italian Master Drawings from the Princeton University Art Museum, (Princeton, NJ: Princeton University Art Museum, 2014)., p. 268, app. no. 116 (illus.)

exhibitions.citation: Medals to Masters: Drawings and Medals. The Italian Renaissance to Modern America, April 1987 - August 1987

displaymaker: attributed to Francesco Villamena, Assisi 1564–1624 Rome
caption: Attributed to Francesco Villamena (Assisi 1564–1624 Rome), View of the River Tiber, ca. 1600. Pen and brown ink on tan laid paper; 20 × 31 cm. Gift of Emily Townsend Vermeule, honorary degree holder of the Class of 1989, and Cornelius Clarkson Vermeule III, in memory of Alphaeus Hyatt Mayor, Class of 1922, George Rodney Meneely, Class of 1933, and Cornelius Clarkson Vermeule Jr., Class of 1917 (1997-61)
